alert.note: Alert for Washington (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 01 at 6:01PM EST until January 02 at 5:00PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Ohio, including the following county, Washington. * WHEN...Until midnight EST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 555 PM EST, At 655 PM EST, the automated gauge at Macksburg on Duck Creek was at 12.36 feet and rising. Bankfull is 13.0 feet and expected to be exceeded shortly. At stages between 13 and 15 feet Broad Street starts to flood near the creek. Homes on the left bank start to flood. Campground next to gauge floods. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Macksburg and Lower Salem. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Please report Severe Weather to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely. You may also report severe weather by posting your report to the Charleston West Virginia National Weather Service Facebook Page, or by using the Twitter Hashtag, NWSRLX.
